intro: Stomatium villetii, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish in color. Stomatium villetii is native to tropical and subtropical regions and thrives in warm, humid climates. It is often found in wetland areas and can be an invasive species in certain environments.
